title: The Best Red Carpet Looks At The 2025 Grammy Awards
description: It’s officially awards season, and that doesn’t only mean celebrating the latest and greatest in movies and TV, but the songs and artists who also got us through the year. Enter: The Grammys. As music’s biggest night, the annual awards ceremony is known for giving fans a little bit of everything — from exciting performances and history-making wins, to another Beyoncé Album of the Year snub (come on Recording Academy, it’s *time*). And, without fail — great fashion. Style-wise, the Grammys red carpet is known for being a little adventurous, with celebs taking the opportunity to have fun with their sartorial choices. From JLo debuting her now iconic and internet-breaking plunging Versace gown in 2000 (which led to the creation of Google Images) to pop princess Miley Cyrus channeling Barbarella at last year’s carpet, the looks are always serving. And this year was no different. With famous faces and style icons like Chappell Roan, Sabrina Carpenter, and Beyoncé nominated, it’s no surprise that this year’s red carpet was a lesson in A+ style. Ahead, check out the best red carpet looks from the 67th annual Grammy Awards (so far). We'll be updating this list throughout the night so stick around!Charli XCX in Jean Paul GaultierPhoto: Matt Winkelmeyer/Getty Images/The Recording Academy.Sabrina Carpenter in JW AndersonPhoto: Kevin html:
Photo: Jon Kopaloff/WireImage.

It’s officially awards season, and that doesn’t only mean celebrating the latest and greatest in movies and TV, but the songs and artists who also got us through the year. Enter: The Grammys. As music’s biggest night, the annual awards ceremony is known for giving fans a little bit of everything — from exciting performances and history-making wins, to another Beyoncé Album of the Year snub (come on Recording Academy, it’s *time*). And, without fail — great fashion. 

Style-wise, the Grammys red carpet is known for being a little adventurous, with celebs taking the opportunity to have fun with their sartorial choices. From JLo debuting her now iconic and internet-breaking plunging Versace gown in 2000 (which led to the creation of Google Images) to pop princess Miley Cyrus channeling Barbarella at last year’s carpet, the looks are always serving. And this year was no different. With famous faces and style icons like Chappell Roan, Sabrina Carpenter, and Beyoncé nominated, it’s no surprise that this year’s red carpet was a lesson in A+ style.

Ahead, check out the best red carpet looks from the 67th annual Grammy Awards (so far). We'll be updating this list throughout the night so stick around!
